cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 90 mi SW of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest toward western Cuba tonight, then turning north-northeast across the eastern Gulf toward the west-central Florida coast before moving inland and crossing north-central/NE Florida toward the Atlantic and the coastal Carolinas.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast near the Tampa Bay/Englewood area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Englewood to Anclote River including Tampa Bay; Tropical Storm Watch Englewood southward to Chokoloskee and Little Cayman/Brac.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Grand Cayman and parts of western Cuba; Tropical Storm Warning lower Florida Keys and portions of western Cuba.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula and Keys, eastern Gulf Coast from the Florida Panhandle southward, and Atlantic coasts of northeast Florida through the Carolinas.
weather_observation.wind: High chance (58%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds with a 26% chance of 50-kt winds at Jacksonville Thursday into Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Onshore flow as the center moves east of the port late Thursday/early Friday could push water levels 2–4 ft above ground locally, with higher minor flooding in the St. Johns River.
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast 3–8 inches across north Florida; local totals near or just above 4 inches likely around Jacksonville causing urban and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous rip currents beginning mid-week; possible short-term port closure due to gale-force winds and heavy rain.
